pullRequest.title: Standardize the logging message format in ClusterAccessor and ConfigAccessor
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issues

 My PR addresses the following Helix issues and references them in the PR description:

This PR takes advantage of parameterized message provided by slf4j to form logging messages in ClusterAccessor and ConfigAccessor. The parameterized message gives a clear syntax than simply concatenating the strings and variables.
Description

 Here are some details about my PR, including screenshots of any UI changes:

All the logging messages inside ClusterAccessor class and ConfigAccessor class are changed to parameterized messages. Auto-reformatted the two classes.
Tests

 The following is the result of the "mvn test" command on the appropriate module:

Results :
Tests run: 99, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time:  39.919 s
[INFO] Finished at: 2020-03-11T13:08:59-07:00
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------
Commits

 My commits all reference appropriate Apache Helix GitHub issues in their subject lines. In addition, my commits follow the guidelines from "How to write a good git commit message":

Subject is separated from body by a blank line
Subject is limited to 50 characters (not including Jira issue reference)
Subject does not end with a period
Subject uses the imperative mood ("add", not "adding")
Body wraps at 72 characters
Body explains "what" and "why", not "how"



Code Quality

 My diff has been formatted using helix-style.xml
(helix-style-intellij.xml if IntelliJ IDE is used)

commit.message: Standardize the logging message format in ClusterAccessor and ConfigAccessor

nodes.bodyText:
Thanks for doing this!

Does this include the new endpoints?
LOG is the convention we use throughout our codebase. Could you also quickly change logger's to LOG?

commit.message: Change logging variable name in ClusterAccessor
